title.value: Improved DC-Free Run-Length Limited 4B6B Codes for Concatenated Schemes
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Improved DC-Free Run-Length Limited 4B6B Codes for Concatenated Schemes

extractions.description: This research paper proposes a new class of DC-free 4B6B codes with improved error correction performance for serially concatenated architectures in visible light communication systems. The paper discusses how permutations of the original 4B6B code's codewords can lead to better performance, especially when concatenated with forward error correction codes, as compared to traditional schemes like Manchester and eMiller codes.

type.justification: The paper includes simulations showing improved performance of the proposed codes, which indicates an empirical study.
type.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as the original 4B6B code, the enhanced Miller code, the Manchester code, the 5B10B code and the (0,4) 2/3 RLL code.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving codes for visible light communication systems, which is part of the telecommunications field.
name.quote: Visible light communication (VLC) consists of transmitting information through light by using light emitting diodes (LED) as transmitter and photo detector (PD) as receivers.

name.justification: The research deals with improvements in DC-free 4B6B codes and forward error correction for visible light communication.
name.quote: In this letter, we introduce a class of improved DC-free 4B6B codes in terms of error correction capabilities for a serially concatenated architecture.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the performance of the proposed scheme against the traditional 4B6B code, implying it is discussed as a model.
name.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as the original 4B6B code.

is_contributed.justification: The original 4B6B Code is used as a baseline for comparison, not as a newly contributed model.
is_contributed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as the original 4B6B code.

is_executed.justification: The original 4B6B code is used in simulations to compare its performance with the proposed code, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as the original 4B6B code.

is_compared.justification: The performance of this model is compared to that of the proposed 4B6B code and other existing codes like eMiller, Manchester, and 5B10B.
is_compared.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as the original 4B6B code.

referenced_paper_title.value: IEEE Standard for Local and Metropolitan Area Networksâ€”Part 15.7: Short-Range Wireless Optical Communication Using Visible Light
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original 4B6B code is part of the IEEE 802.15.7 standard mentioned as the reference for this code.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The traditional 4B6B code is suitable for hard-decision decoding, however, when a soft decoder is used like in a serially concatenated architecture, that code becomes obsolete.

name.justification: The Enhanced Miller code is mentioned in the performance comparison, indicating its role as a referenced model.
name.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the enhanced Miller code.

is_contributed.justification: The Enhanced Miller Code is used for performance comparison, not as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: A new class of improved 4B6B codes was introduced for VLC systems ... Simulation results showed that the proposed 4B6B code outperforms state-of-the-art RLL codes for a concatenated scheme in terms of error correction capabilities.

is_executed.justification: The code is used in simulations to benchmark its performance against the newly proposed code, indicating execution in the study.
is_executed.quote: The Enhanced Miller code is one of the schemes used for comparison in simulations against the proposed 4B6B code.

is_compared.justification: The Enhanced Miller code's performance is compared to the proposed 4B6B code and other models like the original 4B6B and Manchester codes.
is_compared.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the enhanced Miller code.

referenced_paper_title.value: New Miller codes for run-length control in visible light communications
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper by X. Lu and J. Li is mentioned in reference to the Enhanced Miller code.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In [5], the eMiller code was introduced as an enhanced version of the Miller code for run-length control in VLC.

name.justification: The Manchester Code is used for performance comparison in the study, indicating its role as a model.
name.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the Manchester code.

is_contributed.justification: Manchester Code is a well-known encoding scheme and not a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the Manchester code.

is_executed.justification: The Manchester code is executed for simulation comparisons in the study.
is_executed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the Manchester code.

is_compared.justification: The Manchester Code's performance is compared against the proposed 4B6B code and other models.
is_compared.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the Manchester code.

referenced_paper_title.value: Design of polar codes for run-length limited codes in visible light communications
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Manchester code offers a point of comparison in the performance metrics of run-length limited codes, though not directly derived from this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The most used RLL codes in VLC are Manchester, 4B6B and 8B10B codes.

name.justification: The 5B10B code is referenced and compared for its performance in error correction and computational complexity.
name.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the 5B10B code.

is_contributed.justification: 5B10B Code is referenced and used for comparison, not an original contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the 5B10B code.

is_executed.justification: The 5B10B code is executed in simulations as a comparitive baseline against the proposed code.
is_executed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the 5B10B code.

is_compared.justification: The performance of 5B10B Code is compared to other models including the proposed 4B6B code.
is_compared.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the 5B10B code.

referenced_paper_title.value: New RLL code with improved error performance for visible light communication
referenced_paper_title.justification: Reference to the code is made in the context of state-of-the-art RLL codes performance improvement with respect to error correction.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A 5B10B code was proposed in [6]. Although it was reported to improve the error performance compared to the Manchester and the 4B6B codes, its spectral efficiency is similar to that of the Manchester code.

name.justification: The (0,4) 2/3 RLL Code is used as a comparative model to evaluate the performance of the proposed code.
name.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the (0,4) 2/3 RLL code.

is_contributed.justification: The (0,4) 2/3 RLL Code is used for performance comparison and not an original contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the (0,4) 2/3 RLL code.

is_executed.justification: The (0,4) 2/3 RLL Code is executed in simulations to compare its performance against the proposed 4B6B code.
is_executed.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the (0,4) 2/3 RLL code.

is_compared.justification: This code's performance is directly compared to that of the proposed 4B6B code in simulations.
is_compared.quote: Simulations show that the proposed 4B6B code concatenated with forward error correction (FEC) codes, has better performance compared to state-of-the-art schemes such as ... the (0,4) 2/3 RLL code.

referenced_paper_title.value: New run-length limited codes in onâ€“off keying visible light communication systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The code in question is part of existing literature and it is utilized as a reference model in the performance assessment.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In [7], a class of rate (n âˆ’ 1)/n RLL codes was described. A matrix transition was designed for (0, k) RLL codes for k = [3, 7] with (0, k) being the minimum and maximum of consecutive zeros in a codeword respectively.
